lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Economists say the system's fortunes now will depend largely on the success of an agreement last month among major industrial nations to stabilise exchange rates.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The European Monetary System marks its eighth anniversary still vulnerable to turmoil in world money markets despite creating an island of currency rate stability in Europe, economists say.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Under this phase, originally due to have started two years after the EMS was set up, decision-making was to have been transferred from national governments and central banks to an autonomous European Monetary Fund.
